Title: THE BATTLE AT PRAIRIE GROVE, ARK.
Abstract: Death has reaped a terrible harvest to-day. The "Battle of Prairie Grove" will long be remembered by the people of the West, and it will fill a conspicuous place in the future history of thin cruel and unholy war.
copyright: Copyright New York Times Company Dec 27, 1862
Database: ProQuest Historical Newspapers: The New York Times (1851-2009)

Title: THE ARMY OF THE FRONTIER.
Abstract: Another great battle has been fought in Northwestern Arkansas. The speculations of your correspondent, concerning the probability of an immediate, uninterrupted advance to Fort Smith, were premature. The battle of Cane Hill was not decisive.
Authors:
Correspondence of the New-York Times.
Correspondence of the New-York Times.
copyright: Copyright New York Times Company Dec 26, 1862

Title: The Recent Battle at Prairie Grove.
copyright: Copyright New York Times Company Dec 19, 1862

Title: THE WAR IN ARKANSAS.
Abstract: The following additional particulars of the battle of Prairie Grove have been received. The official report puts the loss in killed and wounded in HERRON'S command at 843; BLUNT's, 152; total 995. Later accounts increase the rebel loss to
copyright: Copyright New York Times Company Dec 18, 1862
Database: ProQuest Historical Newspapers: The New York Times (1851-2009)

Title: THE BATTLE OF FAVETTVILLE.
Abstract: To Maj.-Gen. Curtis: This place on yesterday was the scene of a hard, fought and bloody field, resulting in a complete victory of the Army of the Frontier.
copyright: Copyright New York Times Company Dec 13, 1862
Database: ProQuest Historical Newspapers: The New York Times (1851-2009)

Title: STILL FURTHER PARTICULARS.
Abstract: Gen. BLUNT telegraphs Gen. CURTIS that the rebels with whom he fought the battle of Prairie Grove, near Fayetteville, Ark., have probably crossed the Arkansas River.
copyright: Copyright New York Times Company Dec 12, 1862
Database: ProQuest Historical Newspapers: The New York Times (1851-2009)

Title: THE WAR IN ARKANSAS.
Abstract: The official dispatch of the battle of Fayetteville has been received at the headquarters of the army here:
copyright: Copyright New York Times Company Dec 11, 1862

Title: GOOD NEWS FROM ARKANSAS.
Abstract: Gen. HERRON's forces, en route to reinforce Gen. BLENT, met the enemy yesterday on Crawford's Prairie, ten miles south of Fayetteville, Ark., and won a decisive victory.
copyright: Copyright New York Times Company Dec 10, 1862
